title: Multi-Stakeholder Collaboratives
prompt: A wide table in a modest community center or church basement, captured from above at golden hour, showing scattered papers, coffee cups, and notebooks with several hands positioned around it—some leaning forward, others withdrawn. Warm, diffused light streams through tall windows, casting long shadows across the table. The composition emphasizes the uneven distribution of space and attention: professional materials clustered at one end, empty chairs or silhouettes of people sitting back at the other. The photograph has the texture of documentary reportage—slightly grainy, truthful in its rendering of how power and participation actually distribute themselves in a room. No faces visible, only the material evidence of who occupies space and how.
